cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 475 miles ESE of Isla Beata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: moving W-NW through the eastern Caribbean, forecast to slow, turn NW toward Jamaica and eastern-central Cuba Sunday, then track into the Florida Straits and the eastern Gulf aiming toward the west–central Florida peninsula and north Florida coast by Tuesday–Wednesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central or western Cuba (likely near the provinces of Camaguey/Granma)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for eastern and central Cuba; Tropical Storm Watch north Dominican coast, Saba & Sint-Eustatius, Cayman Brac and Little Cayman
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning southern Dominican Republic Punta Palenque-Haiti border, southern Haiti Port-au-Prince westward, Jamaica; Tropical Storm Warning south coast Dominican Republic east of Punta Palenque to Cabo Engaño and north coast Haiti
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greater Antilles (Hispaniola, Jamaica, Cuba) then South Florida including the Florida Keys and southeastern Florida coastline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible late Monday night through Tuesday at PortMiami
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor Atlantic-side surge (<3 ft); higher values expected on Gulf and Keys side, not directly at PortMiami
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated higher totals could produce localized flooding in the Miami metro area
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas and dangerous rip currents in and near the port approaches; possible brief tornadoes in outer rain bands
